div.p: It’s totally dependent on the job; you’ve got to be very focused on whichever job that you apply for, you can’t get away with sending a generic email
saying I’m really hard-working, I’m a really good student and things like that, that’s something that everybody says you’ve got to set yourself out differently
from the rest and it doesn’t matter if it’s a cashier job at a supermarket or whether it’s, you know, investment banking or something really complex
like being a doctor you’ve got to be able to show some kind of personality that reflects that you have those attributes of being able to work hard
and, you know, you’re intelligent and you’ve got the right rapport with people; it’s about projecting yourself as a human being more than what grades you’ve got
